org.jsimpledb.kv.leveldb

Class LevelDBKVDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsimpledb.kv.leveldb.LevelDBKVDatabase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KVDatabase

    public class LevelDBKVDatabase
extends Object
implements KVDatabase
    KVDatabase implementation based on LevelDB and providing linearizable ACID semantics.

    Instances implement a simple optimistic locking scheme for MVCC using LevelDB snapshots. Concurrent transactions do not contend for any locks until commit time. Each transaction's reads are noted and its writes are batched up. At commit time, if any other transactions have committed writes since the transaction's snapshot was created that conflict with any of the transaction's reads, a RetryTransactionException is thrown. Otherwise, the transaction is committed and its writes are applied.

    A database directory is the only required configuration property. Instances may be stopped and (re)started multiple times.

    The LevelDB Java implementation is configurable by specifying the DBFactory implementation.

    See Also:
    leveldb, leveldbjni

      • DB_FACTORY_PROPERTY

        public static final String DB_FACTORY_PROPERTY
        The name of a system property that can be set to override the default DBFactory logic. Set to the name of a class that implements DBFactory and has a zero-arg constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelDBKVDatabase

        public LevelDBKVDatabase()
        Constructor.

        First tries the class specified by the DB_FACTORY_PROPERTY system property, if any, then leveldbjni, and finally leveldb.

        @PostConstruct
public void start()
                          throws IOException

        This method is idempotent.
